page.title: 03LODGE FARM _DURSTON
page.content: Lodge Farm,Durston is a 600 acre farm.It is mainly Grade 2 land.The whole farm is under crop production. Over the last ten years the farmer has gradually diversified his production. He now grows wheat,barley,oats,lupins, sunflowers,oilseed rape,peas,beans and grass.He said the major problems of today were,keeping up with inflation and coping with cuts in crop prices. The farmer and three full_time men work the farm.On the farm there are seven tractors,one combine harvester, two lorries and an assortment of spraying and drilling equipment. 100 years ago this land was made up of six separate farms on the Portman Estate.Due to death duties the estate was sold.In the 1930's the farmer's father bought one of the farms and since then the family has gradually bought the adjoining land.
